From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To change the flow control stop character for the current session, use the **terminal stop-character** command in EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: ASCII decimal representation of the stop character.

Examples: In the following example, the stop character is configured as Ctrl-E (ASCII character decimal 5) for the current session:
ExtraInfo: The flow control stop character signals the end of data transmission when software flow control is in effect.See the "ASCII Character Set and Hexidecimal Values" appendix for a list of ASCII characters.

RelatedCmds.description: Sets the flow control stop character.
